meanings.definition: The state or quality of being jocund or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: Her face lit up with jocundities when she saw her friends.
meanings.sent2: The party was filled with jocundities and laughter.
meanings.sent3: The jocundities of the children playing in the park brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: In the midst of sorrow, he found solace in the jocundities of nature.
meanings.sent5: The jocundities of springtime always lifted her spirits.

meanings.definition: Acts or expressions of merriment or joy.
meanings.sent1: The jocundities of the celebration echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: His jokes and laughter added to the jocundities of the gathering.
meanings.sent3: The jocundities of the clown's performance had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The jocundities of the holiday season filled the town with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The jocundities of their friendship made every moment together special.
